intro: Specularia arvensis, commonly known as field scabious, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Caprifoliaceae and is characterized by its delicate, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and along roadsides, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and hairy, while its stems are slender and often branching. The flowers bloom from late spring to early summer, attracting a variety of pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
